intro: Lepiniopsis ternatensis, commonly known as the Ternate lepiniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
